title: help with newspaper faces
content:
hi

anyone know what the headline(times-esque serif) & blurb types(condensed sans) are for the telegraph?  
 [http://news.bbc.co.uk/nol/shared/spl/hi/pop\_ups/newspapers/today/img/4.j...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212453/http:/news.bbc.co.uk/nol/shared/spl/hi/pop_ups/newspapers/today/img/4.jpg "http://news.bbc.co.uk/nol/shared/spl/hi/pop\_ups/newspapers/today/img/4.jpg")

im also after the types used in the evening standard

[http://www.mirthcontrol.org.uk/images-press-cuttings/ayesha-hazarika-eve...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212453/http:/www.mirthcontrol.org.uk/images-press-cuttings/ayesha-hazarika-evening-standard-may-2005.jpg "http://www.mirthcontrol.org.uk/images-press-cuttings/ayesha-hazarika-evening-standard-may-2005.jpg")

any help is much appreciated!

regards

 [‹ Please help with identifying this font.](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212453/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39493 "Go to previous forum topic") [What font is this ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212453/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39483 "Go to next forum topic")
author: balance

comments.content: For the Daily Telegraph serif (as your sample is rather small), you might wanna check out [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212453/http:/www.typophile.com/node/8404) and [that old thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212453/http:/www.typophile.com/node/16993).
